attributes.action: Reduce university tuition fees to their pre-2010 fee of £3250 P/A.
attributes.additional_details: If the fee cannot be reduced to the (still excessive) £3250 mark, then we demand transparency from the institutions. They should disclose a) where our £9250 goes every year - every single pound of it; and b) what has changed since 2010, causing them to require an additional £6000 from every student, every year.
attributes.background: in 2010 the university tuition fee cap was £3250, however 2010 saw a rise to £9000, and 2017 has seen a further rise to £9250. These should be reduced back to £3250 to ensure fair access to university, and to avoid crippling debt upon graduation.
